questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for water?
questions.explanation: Water is represented by H2O (two hydrogen atoms, one oxygen).

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is called the Red Planet due to iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.explanation: Skin is the body’s largest organ, covering the entire surface.

questions.question: Which gas do humans exhale after breathing?
questions.explanation: Humans exhale carbon dioxide after respiration.

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water at sea level?
questions.explanation: Water boils at 100°C (212°F) at standard pressure.

questions.question: Which vitamin is produced in the skin when exposed to sunlight?
questions.explanation: Vitamin D is synthesized when skin is exposed to UV rays.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.explanation: Diamond is the hardest known natural material.

questions.question: Which planet is the largest in our Solar System?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is the largest, over 300 times the mass of Earth.

questions.question: How many bones are in the adult human body?
questions.explanation: The adult body has 206 bones.

questions.question: What type of blood cells help fight infections?
questions.explanation: White blood cells are essential for the immune system.

questions.question: What is the main gas found in the air we breathe?
questions.explanation: Nitrogen makes up about 78% of Earth’s atmosphere.

questions.question: Which organ pumps blood through the human body?
questions.explanation: The heart pumps blood throughout the body.

questions.question: What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: Light travels at approximately 300,000 kilometers per second.

questions.question: Which part of the plant conducts photosynthesis?
questions.explanation: Leaves contain chlorophyll, which performs photosynthesis.

questions.question: Which scientist developed the theory of relativity?
questions.explanation: Einstein proposed the theory of relativity in the early 20th century.

questions.question: What part of the cell contains genetic material?
questions.explanation: The nucleus houses DNA in eukaryotic cells.

questions.question: Which natural satellite orbits the Earth?
questions.explanation: The Moon is Earth’s only natural satellite.

questions.question: What force keeps planets in orbit around the Sun?
questions.explanation: Gravity pulls planets towards the Sun, keeping them in orbit.

questions.question: Which layer of the Earth contains molten rock?
questions.explanation: The mantle has semi-molten rock called magma.

questions.question: What unit is used to measure electrical current?
questions.explanation: Current is measured in amperes (amps).
